name: The Homestead

reviews.text: Resort was beautiful but some prices were over the top.we went to sam sneads but did not have reservations so hostess suggested commonwealth room buffet dinner.so back to the hotel we went.the buffet was very average until we got the bill.60.00 per person plus extra charges made our bill for two 158.00.You expect to pay in a resort but this was over the top.
reviews.title: stay away from commonwealth dining room

reviews.title: ONE OF THE BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been to The Homestead 6 years ago. They were in transition then and we vowed we would never go back. My son took a chance and treated us all to a Fourth Of July vacation. I can't say enough about it. The food and service was first rate. I had a facial for the first time in my life and I can't believe what I've been missing. My two sons had a great time on their beautiful golf course. My husband and son went Clay Shooting and really enjoyed that. My granddaughters went horse back riding and loved it. The indoor pool fed by the warm springs was relaxing and comforting. The breakfeast buffet just can't be beat anywhere. Dinner in the Dining Room was spectacular. The 4th of July BBQ didn't dissapoint. The entertainment was good but the fireworks show was the best I've seen in a very long time. Truly a memorable weekend for all. One I will remember for many years to come. Thanks to a great time and a truly wonderful, generous son. Take your family here. You'll never regret it.
reviews.title: Very memorable anniversary weekend!

reviews.text: My husband treated me to a weekend to celebrate our 5th anniversary. The trip included three spa treatments for me (so worth it!). I felt I was treated like a true VIP. Our room with balcony couldn't have been more lovely and spacious. We both felt the staff is exceptional here -- they do their utmost to see you are well taken care of. The breakfast buffet is particularly wonderful -- the best eggs and bacon I have ever tasted! So many choices and all quite delicious. We hope to return in the spring or the fall to see the property from a different perspective and hopefully ride our motorcycle as the drive there from Washington DC is also beautiful. Yes, it's expensive but it's true luxury!!!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel.

reviews.text: We have been staying in this hotel for 15 or more years. We go 3-5 times a year, and it is amazing. You can do anything here. You can swim, ride horses, play golf on their challenging courses, go for a carriage ride, play tennis, go for a hike, go to the spa, and much, much more. The service for us is amazing, and very helpful. It has a very old-timey atmosphere, as it should. It is not a modern resort, and you definitely get the feel of it. We love this resort and we recommend it to all of our friends.
reviews.title: Great Setting, Good Service, But, the Food?

reviews.text: I recently attended a wedding here and stayed for a long weekend, so my stay was perhaps atypical of other guests.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with Massive Grounds, but not perfect amenities
Holistic Upgrade Needed
reviews.text: First off, the resort is absolutely massive and beautiful. The outdoor deck area was great for relaxing, the view from the room very nice, and overall the place screamed of an almost Gone With the Wind kind of old Southern opulence.

There were some negatives. The resort is massive and surrounded by nothing by mountains, which means if you miss breakfast (which ends at 10:30), so you're out of luck in terms of eating breakfast. Also, it seemed the prices for everything seemed to be incredibly extravagant. Also, while we enjoyed the sandwiches at Martha's Market they certainly seemed overpriced, and now reading the previous reviews I'm not certain we weren't overcharged every time we ate there. But everything just seemed more expensive, from the cigars in the shops to the alcohol at the bar.
reviews.title: Charm, Beauty and Comfort All in One Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a beautiful hotel with a lot of charm, just be ready to pay for everything... and pay a lot. Also, be forewarned most places include a service fee. However, I'd absolutely recommend this resort. If you're willing to spend the money, you can have an amazing time here.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, limited choices

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at the Homestead. The grounds are simply beautiful and we truly enjoyed our beverage on the porch which had lounge and rocking chairs. The hotel is beautiful as well with old fashioned rooms with high ceilings and hugh closets. The fitness center was great as well. The indoor pool was fabulous with the water coming from the hot springs. The only problem I found is that the food was just ok. I do not think I would eat in the main dining room again. Next time I would try some of the restaurants in town. We came on a Sunday and the restaurants in town were closed. The golf courses were beautiful as well. We did not have a problem with any of the wait staff. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The stars at night were magnficiant.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in early August and took advantage of the "unlimited activities" package, paying $275 per night (for two of us), which, while undoubtedly no small fee, ultimately seemed like a great value. Taking the advice of the reservations person I talked to, we booked our activities about two weeks ahead of time and had little problem finding available activity reservations (with perhaps a couple exceptions that were typically either accommodated on different days of our visit or otherwise replaced with other activities).
reviews.title: Just a wonderful place.
book for activities ahead of time
reviews.text: As a 36-year-old, I've been fortunate enough to have visited some extremely nice resorts on a honeymoon and a few other annual vacations (e.g., the Ritz in Maui and the Royal Hideaway in Playa Del Carmen). I was surprised to find that the Homestead held its own compared to my other luxury resort experiences. The grounds are charming, elegantly detailed and altogether beautiful. In a very much unexpected way, the pool area reminded me slightly of Hawaii without the saltwater, surrounded as it is by green mountains. We played the Old Course three times, kayaked, shot at the rifle range (not hunters or gun enthusiasts -- just for the novelty) rode horses through the woods ... for the extra $100 a day for the both of us (and given that the greens fees alone are normally $160 each!) we feel like we got a great deal.

reviews.title: Still Elegant
reviews.text: Downsides ... while we thought the food at both the Sam Snead Tavern and the Dining Room was very good (and at times, excellent), it was a bit pricey. Given the fact there is very little else around in terms of local restaurants (e.g., a Subway and a couple other modest places), Homestead visitors are largely bound to their restaurants. We enjoyed them, but be prepared to spend significantly more than you might expect ... That said, the Dining Room offered a notably romantic atmosphere with a sparkling dance floor catered to by a three piece band that played the old standbys ... the wife and I danced for an hour (and I ain't no dancer -- though the wine and mint juleps [best I've ever had] helped).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other downside: perhaps its an effect of the current economy (as the low rate package deal might also suggest), but clearly some of the finer, superficial details have been neglected. Things like carpets in the hallways and even the upholstery on a room chair or two appeared to need replacing. Bathroom fixtures are aged.
reviews.title: Amazing resort in the Virginia mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I find this a very difficult hotel to review. It is in a nice setting but fairly well off the beaten track with not a great deal of interest (for us) in surrounding areas. The hotel looks and is imposing on arrival. The turn-off for me was the Reception staff who were so far up themselves it was untrue. Against that, other departments - door staff, restaurant, etc were good. Pettifogging regulations such as jacket, collared shirt required and tie preferred for dinner, or, no denim in the Great Hall (Reception) are, to me, both outdated and unnecessary. Others will think it maintains standards.
reviews.title: Not for us, others may like it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Homestead gives a nice feel for the history of the place. How often do you get to stay in a hotel where 22 Presidents visited? The grounds are well kept and the town is unique. We did spa and golf and both were very good. The free room upgrade is a nice touch, as is the afternoon tea.
reviews.title: A great getaway, but will do it different next time

description: Open since 1766, The Omni Homestead is one of America's most storied resorts, offering unparalleled hospitality and southern charm in a 2,000-acre setting within the Allegheny Mountains of southwestern Virginia. Canyon Ranch SpaClub at The Omni Homestead debuted in June 2013 and is the first SpaClub to introduce family spa services. Renowned for its natural hot springs, The Homestead is distinguished by 483 luxurious guest rooms and suites, 72,000 square feet of meeting space, a wide array of fine and casual dining choices, championship golf courses that include one of the nation's finest mountain courses (The Cascades), Allegheny Springs, a two-acre family-friendly water attraction complete with lazy river, water slides and water play zone. The resort also offers the South's first downhill ski area, an Equestrian Center and show ring, top-rated Shooting Club, archery, canoeing, falconry, Segway tours and a wealth of other recreational attractions.
